Bug: Claude 3.5 Sonnet Copilot response issues "I'm Sorry something went wrong with the processing..."
### Software

Copilot Module

### Operating System / Platform

macOS, Windows, Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey 👋,

We are experiencing some issues on and off w/ Claude Sonnet 3.5 within the Copilot Modules of all the applications.

If you are experiencing this issue please first:
1. change the Model runtime to OpenAI or Gemini as these are working very consistently.
2. Ensure you sign in to the Pieces Ecosystem, this will ensure that you have a larger rate limit than those users who are NOT authenticated.

Please feel free to comment in this thread if you are experiencing similar issues!


## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User is experiencing a Copilot bug and unable to use any GPT models other than GPT-4o Mini.

**Problems Identified:**

* Copilot is generating an error message when used.
* User is restricted to only one GPT model.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team routed the issue and suggested related existing issues for reference.
* Provided relevant resources for further information and troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being investigated by the Pieces team.
* The user is awaiting a follow-up within 24 hours.

**Additional Context:**

* Based on the provided description, the user's issue might be related to previously reported bugs concerning Copilot functionality and GPT model limitations.

**Recommendations:**

* User should monitor the issue for updates and follow the suggested resources for potential solutions.

There is a video here that describes the problem
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @Iliya3ProX reported an issue with Long-Term Memory not enabling. 
* @mason-at-pieces requested the user's logs for investigation.
* @mack-at-pieces identified and fixed the issue: Downloaded LLM state overriding saved data.
* A patch was released in version 11.0.1 of PiecesOS and 3.3.1 of the Desktop application.
* @Iliya3ProX confirmed the issue persists after updating and provided logs and a video.
* @AyomideA-S reported the same issue. 

**Problems:**

* Downloaded local LLM state overrode the saved selected model, preventing Long-Term Memory from enabling.
* "Woohoo PiecesOS 11.0 is released 🎉" page opens after every reboot.

**Solutions:**

* The issue was fixed in patch versions 11.0.1 of PiecesOS and 3.3.1 of the desktop application.

**Current Status:**

* The issue may still persist for @Iliya3ProX and @AyomideA-S despite the update. 

**Outcome:**

* Further investigation and potential fixes are needed.

common_issues.title: VS Code Extension Connectivity Issues with Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting the VS Code extension to Pieces OS, particularly within remote environments like Docker containers. This is often due to the extension being unable to automatically determine the correct Pieces OS URL.  Solutions include manually setting the custom URL in the extension settings or ensuring proper port forwarding is configured. The Pieces team is actively working on improving automatic detection and connection capabilities in future releases.

related_issues.title: Can't connect from dev container
related_issues.text: Can't connect from dev container ### Software Pieces OS, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 9.0.7 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. # Issue description Hi, Pieces OS is working fine in VSCode (extension version: `v1.16.2`), until I load into a dev container. VSCode gives me these notifications: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/48d644e3-c170-4caf-8258-d96f2323c2cf) ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/a393edaf-8405-4581-9807-3ae093d078e3) Pieces explorer looks like this: # Attempted fixes I tried to turn off / disable macOS native firewall as well as [Lulu](https://objective-see.org/products/lulu.html) completely, but the issue still persists. Not sure how to make inbound firewall rule for port 1000 on macOS, where you need to specify an exact application associated with firewall rules. # One strange behavior Now, one thing is strange - **if PiecesOS is turned off before opening VSCode and I open a VSCode in dev container straight away, PiecesOS automatically starts and shows me the welcome window**: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/07cd8e60-1b29-4757-8204-c82d87cd39ce) Does it mean, that the VSCode extension inside dev container (i.e. docker container) can communicate with host and startup the application? If so, why does it fail to communicate further? ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: **Key Points Raised:** * Docker container unable to reach Pieces OS instance running on host machine. * Problem occurs specifically within the VS Code Pieces extension in dev container environment. **Problems Identified:** * Communication issue between VS Code extension running within Docker and Pieces OS. * Inability to automatically determine Pieces OS URL within dev container environment. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Manually specifying custom URL in VS Code extension settings to connect directly with Pieces OS. * Enhancement of extension to automatically identify and connect to Pieces OS in future release, eliminating need for custom URL. **Current Status/Outcome:** * Issue resolved for current version through use of custom URL. * Future release planned to address automatic detection and connection to Pieces OS. **Additional Notes:** * Issue also impacts remote development environments like Gitpod. * Documentation updated to reflect cloud-based limitations and port forwarding requirements for remote scenarios. * New startup notification implemented for remote environments to guide users towards relevant documentation.

recommendations: **Prioritize performance improvements:** Allocate resources to address the performance issues reported with Pieces OS 11.0, particularly in the VS Code extension. This will directly impact user experience and productivity.

**Improve VS Code extension connectivity:** Investigate and resolve the connectivity issues between the VS Code extension and Pieces OS, especially in remote environments. Enhance automatic URL detection and provide clear instructions for manual configuration.

**Address Copilot module errors:** Focus on fixing bugs related to the Copilot module, such as the issues with Claude 3.5 Sonnet responses and Long-Term Memory functionality. Ensure compatibility with different GPT models.

**Gather more data on reported issues:** Encourage users to provide detailed information when reporting issues, including logs, screenshots, and steps to reproduce. This will help in faster diagnosis and resolution.

**Proactively communicate known issues:** Maintain a public-facing list of known issues and workarounds to keep users informed and reduce support requests. Provide regular updates on the progress of fixes and improvements.
